jd: From: Paul, Rwaltz paul@rwaltz.com Reply to: paul@rwaltz.com Job Title: Guidewire Technical Project ManagerJob Location: Pocatello, IDJob Type: Long Term MUST: Guidewire ACE Certification mandatory.Job Description:Your Key Responsibilities:To lead and drive a team of developers in a fast-paced environment while solving difficult business problems.Act as the Project / Program Manager to lead and guide program by working closely with Senior IT and Business LeadsDevelop Strategy to implement large Guidewire Policy Center implementation across the product lines in Personal lines.Engage with Senior Executives, Sponsors of the program to review and track the progress of the implementation.Analyze, evaluate, and overcome program risks, and produce program reports for managers and stakeholders and experience in managing stakeholders.Oversee design documents that would be needed to support product configuration – Field mapping, Data definition, rules definition and so onBe responsible for leading the solutioning efforts by developing and presenting POCs.Identify value additions that can be built as configuration components and reused on multiple projects, to gain efficiency / productivity.Coordinate with Client program management team, business users, and team members to drive the scope of program.Ability to manage the program teams in a global delivery model. Coordinate the teams located at different geographical locations.Oversee task allocation, monitoring, and status reporting to the client & project leadershipWhat you need (knowledge, Skills & Experience) Have overall work experience ranging between 12-15 years, with at least 5 years of Guidewire® PolicyCenter, billing center and or Claims Center implementation experience and program management experience.Have a ‘differentiator’ mindset – a practitioner who contributes to asset creation and build the competency / team.Have thorough understanding of agile methodology.Have proven experience as a Project / Program Manager or other managerial position.Have a deep insight into the SDLC and strong understanding of Agile and SAFe methodologies.Demonstrate a strong understanding of application development projects involving the implementation of complex business rules.Have proven technical experience in requirement analysis, detailed designs and implementation activities required to ensure the development, integration, and long-term maintenance of applications.Prior experience with configuration and development of Guidewire® components using GOSU, Wizards, PCF, Data Model, Workflow, Activities, Product Designer etcPrior experience with troubleshooting and resolving technical issues, providing solutions & workarounds to critical requirements.Strong experience on implementing personal lines on Guidewire suite including personal auto, property, umbrella, etc…Expertise in configuration and development of various areas of Guidewire – Transactions, Job configuration, Experience in implementing multiple LOBs, Forms Management, Administration, Account Management, Contacts and so on.Possess excellent oral and written communication skills.Experience working with Guidewire Cloud
